byline.contributor: Austin Frakt is a health economist with several governmental and academic affiliations. He blogs at The Incidental Economist, and you can follow him on Twitter at @afrakt.

abstract: The Upshot; survey conducted by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that fewer Americans are having problems paying medical bills since Affordable Care Act went into effect in 2014, inadvertently improving public health.
lead_paragraph: A reduction in the number of people having trouble paying medical bills appears to be an effect of the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Medical Insurance Is Good for Financial Health, Too
headline.print_headline: Medical Insurance Is Good for Financial Health

snippet: A reduction in the number of people having trouble paying medical bills appears to be an effect of the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
